Serial Mediation Analysis

Source: R/multiple_mediators.R
mediation_serial.Rd

Analyze serial (sequential) mediation where mediators operate in a specific order: X -> M1 -> M2 -> ... -> Y. Tests specific indirect effects through different pathways using bootstrap CIs.

Usage

mediation_serial(
  data,
  x,
  mediators,
  y,
  covariates = NULL,
  conf_level = 0.95,
  boot_samples = 5000,
  boot_method = c("bca", "perc", "norm"),
  seed = NULL
)

Arguments

data

Data frame containing all variables.

x

Name of independent variable (character).

mediators

Character vector of mediator variable names in sequential order (e.g., c("M1", "M2") for X -> M1 -> M2 -> Y).

y

Name of dependent variable (character).

covariates

Optional character vector of covariate names.

conf_level

Confidence level for intervals. Default is 0.95.

boot_samples

Number of bootstrap samples. Minimum 1000, 5000+ recommended for publication.

boot_method

Bootstrap CI method: "bca" (default), "perc", or "norm".

seed

Random seed for reproducibility.

Value

Object of class serial_mediation containing:

paths

Tibble of all path coefficients

specific_indirect

Tibble of specific indirect effects through different pathways with bootstrap CIs

total_indirect

Total indirect effect

direct_effect

Direct effect (c')

total_effect

Total effect (c)

interpretation

Publication-ready interpretation text

Details

**Serial Mediation Model (2 mediators)**:

Path 1: X -> M1 -> Y (a1*b1) Path 2: X -> M2 -> Y (a2*b2) Path 3: X -> M1 -> M2 -> Y (a1*d21*b2) [serial path] Direct: X -> Y (c')

**Specific Indirect Effects**:

  • Through M1 only: X -> M1 -> Y

  • Through M2 only: X -> M2 -> Y

  • Serial through M1 then M2: X -> M1 -> M2 -> Y

The serial path represents the unique contribution of the sequential mediation process.

References

Hayes, A. F. (2018). Introduction to mediation, moderation, and conditional process analysis (2nd ed.). Guilford Press.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Two-mediator serial model
result <- mediation_serial(
  data = consumer_data,
  x = "advertising",
  mediators = c("awareness", "attitude"),
  y = "purchase",
  boot_samples = 5000,
  seed = 123
)
print(result)
} # }
